page.title: 01The Ormskirk Plain
page.content: This block is an area on the edge of the market town of Ormskirk, famous for its Church with both tower and steeple and for its gingerbread and potatoes. The land, part of the Ormskirk Plain, is entirely Class I agricultural land with medium loam soil, artificially drained to give excellent farming land, often yielding two crops annually. From Clieves Hills, with their high point the Devil's Wall, Blackpool, 40 km. away, can easily be seen. Small copses of trees and drainage ditches criss-crossing the land are the most noticeable features of the landscape. The only dwellings are farmhouses and related cottages and barns.
